title: Tariff Tantrum 2.0: Time to look beyond 2026? 6 stocks from different sectors with at least one ‘moat’; and upside potential of up to 31%
summary: The market can live with clear bullishness or even a bearish trend. What it really hates is uncertainty. And these are uncertain times – marked by a spike in volatility. The absence of a clear trend means that these are uncertain times for investors as well. You could “sit out the volatility”, of course. But if you insist on deploying money in the market, it would be safer to look at stocks that may be from different sectors but have at least one common factor – an edge their peers don’t have.

title: Export uncertainty may dull domestic momentum for solar companies
summary: US imposition of a 125.87% countervailing duty on Indian solar modules is set to impact domestic companies by potentially lowering module prices. Exporters may redirect unsold inventory to India, while companies like Waaree Energies are strengthening US manufacturing to mitigate the effects. The duty erodes future revenue visibility for Indian manufacturers targeting the US market.

title: Analysts cautious on IRFC OFS, see limited upside
summary: The government is selling a stake in Indian Railway Finance Corporation. Analysts suggest caution for investors. The offer for sale aims to meet public shareholding norms. The floor price offers limited discount. IRFC has seen loan growth supported by railway capital expenditure. Future gains may depend on market sentiment.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Equities advanced on Wednesday amid positive global cues, though trade uncertainties kept sentiment cautious. Analysts anticipate a range-bound market, guided by macro developments and sector-specific catalysts, with immediate support at 25300 and resistance at 25650-25750. Foreign investors showed strong buying interest.

title: Stocks in news: IRFC, Adani Ports, Lodha Developers, Lupin, RIL
summary: Markets closed higher despite initial volatility on the first day of the new expiry series, though analysts suggest potential for further downside. Several companies like IRFC, Adani Ports, Lodha Developers, Lupin, and RIL are in focus due to significant news developments impacting their operations and financial standing.

title: Vedanta board clears Rs 3,000 crore NCD fundraise
summary: Vedanta's board has greenlit a ₹3,000 crore fundraising initiative via unsecured, rated, and listed non-convertible debentures. These instruments, with a face value of ₹1,00,000 each, are slated for listing on the BSE. CRISIL has assigned a 'CRISIL AA' rating to these NCDs, placing them under 'Rating Watch with Developing Implications'.

title: Bulk Deal Buzz: Promoters offload 5.3% in Aditya Infotech, shares rally 7.3%
summary: Promoter Hari Khemka Business Family Trust and Dixon Technologies divested shares of Aditya Infotech (CPPLUS) worth ₹920.8 crore in bulk deals. The entities sold 62.6 lakh shares at ₹1,470 each, offloading 5.3% of the company's total equity. Major mutual funds and HDFC Life Insurance were among the buyers.

title: India's stock market offers scale and growth: Pandey
summary: India is building a transparent, well-governed, and investable stock market to attract long-term institutional capital, according to Sebi chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey. He highlighted that the country offers scale and growth, with foreign portfolio investor assets tripling to ₹71 lakh crore. Domestic institutional investors are now providing a crucial counterbalance, enhancing market resilience.

title: Sebi ramps up broker dealing room scrutiny
summary: India's market regulator is intensifying its watch on stockbrokers' dealing rooms. This move aims to curb front running, a practice where employees exploit insider knowledge of large trades for personal gain. Authorities are investigating how trades are initiated and executed, focusing on institutional and high-net-worth clients.

title: SAT adjourns hearing in Jane Street case to April 17
summary: The Securities Appellate Tribunal has postponed a key hearing. This case involves US trader Jane Street and market regulator Sebi. Sebi had previously imposed a hefty fine and trading ban on Jane Street. The firm has challenged Sebi's order. The tribunal will now hear the matter on April 17. Jane Street had deposited the fine amount.

title: Metal stocks rise 7%, analysts see potential upside of up to 25%
summary: Metal stocks surged over 7% on Wednesday, driven by firm base metal prices and reduced uncertainty over US tariffs. Analysts suggest buying on dips, anticipating up to 25% upside.  Companies like Lloyds Metals, National Aluminium, and Vedanta saw significant gains as investors shifted funds from IT to the buoyant metal sector.

title: IT bounce breaks 5-day losing run, but analysts warn relief may be short-lived
summary: Indian IT stocks saw a brief rebound on Wednesday, ending a losing streak. However, analysts caution this relief might be temporary. Most derivative bets remain bearish after the IT index's substantial drop. The sector experienced pressure throughout February, with new AI tools intensifying concerns about future revenue. Short covering fueled the bounce, but underlying weakness persists.

title: Stock Radar: Colgate Palmolive stock moves above the Alligator indicator – time to buy?
summary: Colgate-Palmolive India shows bullish signs, breaking above the Alligator indicator. Experts suggest short-term traders consider buying for a potential Rs 2,450 target within weeks. The stock has recovered from a recent decline, with technical indicators like DMI and MACD supporting an upward trend. Entry is recommended in the Rs 2,240-2,220 range.

title: RBI summons Yes Bank executives over forex card breach
summary: The Reserve Bank of India has called in senior Yes Bank executives after a major security incident involving the Yes Bank–BookMyForex multi-currency forex card. According to reports, card numbers and CVV details of numerous customers may have been exposed. The RBI has demanded a full account of how the breach occurred and what safeguards failed.

title: Microfinance in revival mode; MFIs, private banks expand business in January
summary: The microfinance sector is consolidating after a period of stress. Private banks and NBFC-MFIs have increased their lending portfolios. While the overall market saw a slight dip, early delinquency rates are improving. Experts anticipate a return to normal growth by the end of the first quarter of FY27. This marks an inflection point for the industry.

title: Credit card spends moderate in Jan from festival highs in Dec
summary: Credit card spending in India moderated in January to Rs 1.99 lakh crore, down from December's festival-led high but up over 8% year-on-year. This indicates a normalization of growth after a festive surge, with active card numbers rising to 116.6 million, though new additions slowed due to tighter underwriting and regulatory caution.

title: Gold, silver soared in 2025, stocks were major drags. What could 2026 have in store for investors?
summary: After gold and silver delivered spectacular gains in 2025, Indian equities enter 2026 shaped by slower global rate cuts, geopolitical risks and a shift from slowdown to recovery. Largecaps may stay resilient, while mid and smallcaps could benefit from improving consumption trends and banking reforms, though global growth and currency risks persist,  a report by 1 Finance suggest.

title: Turnaround Play: 6 stocks turn profitable in Q3, rally up to 55% in just 3 months
summary: Twenty-seven BSE-listed companies with market caps over Rs 3,000 crore turned profitable sequentially in the December quarter. While six stocks saw share price surges of 10-55%, many others declined, with the top five laggards dropping 20-40% in three months.

title: HAL, BEL and other defence stocks jump up to 5% on potential India-Israel defence deal
summary: Defence stocks such as Hindustan Aeronautics, Bharat Electronics and others gained up to 5% after reports of a potential India–Israel defence pact. The agreement, expected during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Tel Aviv visit, may prioritise technology transfer in missile defence and advanced weapon systems.

title: How much gold is enough? Ray Dalio reveals ideal allocation for your portfolio; find out here
summary: Ray Dalio emphasizes gold's value during instability, citing historical performance during the 1970s and 1930s crises. Gold should comprise 5-15% of portfolios as it acts as a stabilizer and diversifier, protecting wealth when traditional assets struggle amid economic uncertainties.

title: Grade-A office spaces in a sweet spot, but risks loom
summary: As supply increases, stagnation in occupancies or vacancy levels can spoil the party. For now, there is also no clarity on how AI impacts demand for office spaces.

title: Auto sales preview: Strong retail demand to drive double-digit wholesale growth in February: Report
summary: February's wholesale numbers for domestic auto companies are anticipated to show double-digit growth, led by strong demand and new vehicle launches. Major OEMs like Mahindra &amp; Mahindra and Tata Motors expected to see significant sales boosts.

title: RBI broker funding rules could give foreign proprietary traders an edge
summary: Amended capital market exposure rules aimed at curbing bank lending for speculative purposes could raise costs for domestic proprietary traders, benefiting their global counterparts.

title: Dassault Aviation, NVIDIA, to Elbit Systems: Is it possible to buy global stocks on NSE? Explained
summary: The NSE has launched NSE IX, where investors will be able to buy stocks of the selcted global bourses

title: Time to increase exposure to equities; remain overweight on mid, small-caps, says Mihir Vora of TRUST Mutual Fund
summary: Mihir Vora of TRUST Mutual Fund believes this is the right time to increase equity exposure, anticipating healthy earnings growth. Vora highlights that he has been consistently overweight in mid- and small-caps due to greater growth opportunities in these segments.

title: Small-cap stock under  ₹50 hits upper circuit for second straight session
summary: A-1 share price hit a 5% upper circuit following the launch of the Yellow EV brand for electric two-wheelers. The company announced significant partner-driven growth and updates on its mobile app, enhancing customer experience and operational efficiency.

title: ‘Death of Software?’ Anand Mahindra calls AI doom ‘Greatly Exaggerated’ amid IT stock crash
summary: Indian IT stocks face sharp corrections amid AI disruption fears. Anand Mahindra advises against extreme AI doomsday predictions. He believes AI will pressure IT firms to adapt, focusing on outcomes and value delivery. While some roles may change, new opportunities in AI integration and governance will emerge.

title: Market Wrap: Nifty, Sensex end flat in a volatile trade as heavyweight HDFC Bank drags market
summary: Market wrap: The broader Nifty settled at 25,496.55, up 14 points or 0.06%, while the 30-stock index closed at 82,248.61, declining by 27 points or 0.03%.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Feb 26: Tejas Networks, KSB, Mankind Pharma, Tata Motors, Finolex Cables among top gainers
summary: The Indian stock market remained largely unchanged on February 26, with the Nifty 50 up 0.07% at 25,500 and the S&amp;P BSE Sensex flat at 82,267. Broader markets showed mixed results, while US stocks rallied on Nvidia's strong earnings, boosting Asian markets as well.

title: Sensex slips 27 points, Nifty 50 rises 14 points— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
summary: The Sensex ended 27 points, or 0.03%, lower at 82,248.61, while the Nifty 50 inched up by 14 points, or 0.06%, to settle at 25,496.55. The BSE 150 MidCap Index clocked a decent gain of 0.55%, while the BSE 250 SmallCap Index rose by 0.07%.

title: Bank of Japan interest rate decision in focus: Will BOJ tighten policy? How it could impact emerging markets like India
summary: As speculation grows about potential interest rate hikes by the Bank of Japan, experts weigh in on how these changes could impact emerging markets, particularly India. In December, BOJ raised its key policy rate by 25 basis points to 0.75%, which is its highest level since September 1995.

title: Gaudium IVF & Women Health IPO to list at discount? Here's what GMP signals ahead of debut
summary: The shares of Gaudium IVF &amp; Women Health IPO are trading at a premium of  ₹-4 in the grey market, as per the websites tracking the grey market.

title: Striders Impex IPO Day 1: Issue subscribed 61% so far, QIBs steal the show. Check GMP, issue details, more
summary: Striders Impex IPO opened on February 26, priced between  ₹71 and  ₹72 per share. Investors can bid for a minimum of 1,600 shares. The IPO aims to raise funds for expanding retail and e-commerce channels, with a current subscription status of 61% on day one.

title: NSE said to invite i-bank pitches for much-awaited IPO
summary: NSE has issued RFPs to investment banks for its upcoming IPO, targeting an adviser selection by April. The move follows Sebi’s 30 January no-objection clearance.

title: Elbit Systems share price near record high ahead of the India-Israel defence deal
summary: India-Israel defence deal: The defence stock of Israel's stock market has given multibagger returns of 440% in five years

title: Data Patterns among 5 smallcap stocks that hit 52-week high; rally up to 50% in a month
Sebi introduces Life Cycle Funds: Radhika Gupta of Edelweiss MF explains what it means for investors
summary: Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, discusses significant changes in India's asset management due to SEBI's regulatory framework. She emphasizes the introduction of Life Cycle Funds simplifies long-term investing and enhancing goal-based strategies.

title: Stock market holiday: When will the Indian stock market be closed for Holi?
summary: Stock market holiday: Once can access to the entire stock market holidays list by logging in at the BSE or at the NSE websites

title: From US dependency to African opportunity: India's solar industry has new export option post-duty blow.
summary: A new countervailing duty by the US on Indian solar modules are reshaping trade patterns. India's renewable energy ministry sees Africa as a strong alternative for both module exports and for developers setting up projects.

title: Mint Explainer: What does Meta's capitulation mean for Indian WhatsApp users and Big Tech?
summary: After years of legal resistance, the social media giant’s pledge to grant users data-sharing control marks a watershed victory for Indian digital sovereignty and antitrust enforcement.

title: Weekly Top Picks: These stocks scored 10 on 10 on Stock Reports Plus
summary: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, undertakes detailed company analysis for 4,000+ listed stocks. In addition to detailed company analyses, the report also collates analysts’ forecasts and trend analysis for each component. An average score in Stock Reports Plus is calculated by undertaking quantitative analysis of five key investment tools – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum.

title: Gainers & Losers: XTGlobal, Tejas Networks among 5 top movers on Thursday
summary: India’s benchmark indices ended flat amid selling in financial stocks. Individual stocks were active, with XTglobal, Tejas Networks and Sanofi Consumer rallying, Angel One adjusting for stock split, and Home First declining.

title: PNGS Reva Diamond Jewellery IPO sails through on Day 3: Check subscription status, GMP and other key details
summary: PNGS Reva Diamond Jewellery's IPO was fully subscribed on February 26, receiving bids for 70,31,776 shares, 1.23 times the offer. The employee segment was oversubscribed 6.74 times, while the allotment finalisation is on February 27.

title: Info Edge to invest  ₹250 crore in fund to back growth-stage tech startups
summary: The commitment will be made directly by Info Edge and/or through its wholly owned subsidiaries, in one or more tranches

title: Crocs bets on India as top-6 global market, targets Gen-Z
summary: Crocs India is focusing on Gen-Z marketing, launching India-themed ‘Jibbitz’, and gradually scaling its newly acquired casual shoes brand Hey Dude after stabilizing it in the US.

title: Sebi unveils life-cycle mutual funds; solution-oriented schemes scrapped — what it means for your portfolio
summary: Mutual funds will now be permitted to offer both value and contra mutual funds as long as the scheme portfolio overlap between the two schemes is not more than 50%.

title: NSE CEO pitches for minimum qualifying criteria for derivatives trading
summary: NSE's managing director and CEO Ashishkumar Chauhan on Thursday made a case for 'minimum qualifying criteria' for those participating in derivatives trading to prevent people from lower strata of society from wasting their money on speculation.

title: Sebi mandates market intermediaries to disclose registration details on social media from May 1
summary: Sebi has directed all regulated entities and their agents to display registered names and registration numbers on social media platforms. The move aims to enhance transparency, curb misleading content and help investors distinguish between regulated intermediaries and unregistered market participants online.

title: Sebi Working Groups submit agri derivatives review reports to chairman
summary: Working groups constituted by Sebi to review the delivery and settlement framework and existing regulatory norms in the agricultural commodity derivatives segment have submitted their reports to Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey, the regulator said on Thursday.

title: Salesforce shares down 4% in premarket on weak guidance, raising concerns over AI competition
summary: Salesforce shares are expected to open lower after a lukewarm sales growth outlook, trading down 4% pre-market at $183.79. Despite a strong quarterly performance, concerns over AI competition and revenue projections below Wall Street estimates have affected investor sentiment.

title: Sebi caps mutual fund overlap, forces schemes to truly differ
summary: In a circular issued on Thursday, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) capped portfolio overlaps at 50% for sectoral and thematic equity schemes with other equity schemes within the same fund house, barring large-cap funds.

title: India to shift solar manufacturing subsidy from sales-linked PLI to upfront capex support for key components: MNRE secy
summary: The MNRE's new strategy aims to boost domestic production of wafers, ingots, and polysilicon, addressing gaps in previous incentive schemes. This move is crucial for India's ambitious green energy targets.

title: India needs $750 million in flexible funding to build 100 ‘non-profit Unicorns’ in 5 years: Report
summary: A new report reveals India requires $750 million in flexible funding over five years to create 100 'non-profit unicorns' that could significantly impact social development goals. The findings highlight funding constraints and regulatory challenges that hinder the growth of impactful non-profits.

title: Native acquires strategic stake in RPO venture Woven
summary: Native expands into recruitment process outsourcing by taking a stake in Woven to create an end-to-end talent platform.

title: Sebi’s new MF rulebook: Clarity or more clutter?
summary: Sebi's new categorisation circular fixes old problems while handing the industry fresh material for the next round of product clutter

title: Home First Finance bulk deal alert: Promoters sell stake worth Rs 660 crore; Societe Generale among buyers
summary: Home First Finance shares fell nearly 6% after promoters Aether and True North sold Rs 660 crore stake via bulk deals to Societe Generale and PICTET. Despite the decline, the stock has outperformed benchmarks over one year and posted strong quarterly profit growth.

title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Data Patterns and Finolex Cables on Friday for short term gains
summary: The Nifty ended flat as financial stocks dragged despite gains in auto and consumer sectors. Technical indicators signal continued weakness, with resistance at 25,550–25,600 and downside risk toward 25,300. Analysts recommend buying Data Patterns and Finolex Cables on bullish breakouts.

title: Sebi warns investors against fake STT notices, flags market scams
summary: Sebi said it has observed cases where entities impersonate its officials, misuse names and designations, and create fake email IDs resembling those of the regulator.

title: Wall Street: S&P 500, Nasdaq slip as concerns over AI bubble weigh, Nvidia sinks 2.4%
summary: As of 9:35 a.m. Eastern Time, the S&amp;P 500 slipped 0.1% and the Nasdaq Composite was 0.4% lower. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 0.5%.

title: Sebi mandates mutual funds value gold, silver using domestic prices
summary: In a circular issued on Thursday, the market regulator said mutual funds will now value physical gold and silver held by schemes using polled spot prices published by stock exchanges.&nbsp;

title: Sebi tightens social media norms, mandates registration disclosures
summary: Sebi said the objective is to distinguish content posted by registered entities from that of unregistered individuals, thereby strengthening investor protection and promoting ease of doing business.

title: MP Materials selects Texas for rare earth magnet manufacturing site
summary: MP Materials has chosen Northlake, Texas, for its $1.25 billion rare earth magnet factory as the U.S. rushes to secure domestic supplies of critical minerals.

title: Sebi cautions investors against fake notices demanding STT payments
summary: Sebi warns investors about fake notices demanding Securities Transaction Tax payments. Fraudsters are using forged Sebi letterheads to deceive people. The market regulator clarifies it does not issue such notices. Investors are urged to verify all communications. Sebi also cautions against unregistered individuals promising risk-free profits and handling trading accounts. Investors should check Sebi registration before investing.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday
summary: Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex ended largely unchanged as financial stocks, led by HDFC Bank, offset gains in auto and FMCG shares. Analysts flagged weak momentum, bearish technical signals and key support near 25,400, indicating choppy trade and possible near-term downside.

title: Sebi Working Groups submit reports on agri commodity derivatives to Chairman for review
summary: Sebi's working groups are reviewing the delivery and settlement framework in agricultural commodity derivatives. The expert panels were tasked with assessing whether the current framework governing margins, position limits, and delivery and settlement mechanisms could be improved.

title: Gold, silver rates today: Comex gold drops $72/oz; silver falls $4.90/oz ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks
summary: Gold and silver prices declined on February 26 as investors awaited US-Iran nuclear talks. April gold futures fell to $5,154, while March silver futures dropped to $86.13.&nbsp;

title: Vishal Mega Mart promoter entity likely to sell 6.5% stake via block deal: Report
summary: Vishal Mega Mart's promoter, Samayat Services LLP, is set to sell a 6.5% stake through a block deal at Rs 115 per share, a 10% discount to the current market price. This move comes as the company reported a 19% rise in net profit for the December quarter.

title: 560% return in five years! Multibagger FMCG stock to be in focus on Friday; here's why
summary: Multibagger stock: Shares of FMCG brand GRM Overseas is expected to be in focus on Friday, 27 February after the company informed that it has acquired UAE based GRM ARABIA FZCO.

title: Intuit shares climb over 2% ahead of Q2 earnings
summary: Analysts largely expect the results to demonstrate year-over-year growth in both revenue and earnings per share&nbsp;

title: Local investors may get to sell shares in GIFT City's secondary market
summary: Two years after a change in rules allowed Indian companies to list in GIFT City exchanges, just one company has stepped up. Now, the regulators - IFSCA and RBI - are discussing with Centre if local shareholders can be allowed to trade in secondary markets in GIFT City.

title: Layoff news: CNBC to cut nearly a dozen jobs; unify digital, TV news operations, says report
summary: CNBC to unify digital and TV news operations, cut nearly a dozen jobs, says report.

title: Soybeans ease on profit taking after hitting 20-month peak on demand hopes
summary: GLOBAL-GRAINS/ (UPDATE 2):GRAINS-Soybeans ease on profit taking after hitting 20-month peak on demand hopes

title: FS KKR Private Credit Fund Sinks on Dividend Cut, Bad Loans
summary: A private credit fund jointly managed by Future Standard and KKR & Co. plunged after cutting its dividend more than forecast, as earnings declined amid lower interest rates and losses from troubled investments.

title: Wall St slides as tech rally stalls, AI enthusiasm wanes after Nvidia results
summary: USA-STOCKS/ (UPDATE 5):US STOCKS-Wal

title: EU Commission Asks Anti-Fraud Watchdog to Probe Mandelson
summary: The European Union’s anti-fraud office has been asked to “look into” the conduct of Peter Mandelson during his time as the bloc’s trade chief, after further details of the British politician’s links with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein came to light.
